column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This is a great drug to use to get off of narcotic pain killers once the pain has begun to subside.  I found 200 mg needed for any real impact and I take another 200 late in the pm to help with night activities.  There is some itching but not bad.  Regarding stomach, it depends what you eat.   If you eat rich or gasey foods it does not work but basic fiber and fruit etc tend to make things tolerable.  Experiment with diet.  I have found that the effect wears off with time BUT there is still an impact and much fewer side effects than with narcotic pain killers etc.  A good drug overall.  Start with 50 going to 100 a week later and 200 a week after than and you will not notice the side effects.  At lease for me.  Good luck to all.

column2: meredith, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Several months ago I fell and fractured a pelvic bone - Pubic Ramus  - 5 cm fx. Anyone familiar with this fx knows it is very painful. After 2 1/2 months my x-rays showed considerable healing and new bone growth. I was informed by my ortho that the muscles would eventually lose the edema and inflamation. Facing returning to work as a busy pharmcacy tech, knowing that I could not continue taking Norco - I asked my PCP for a drug I could take and still function. I must be able to think! He recommended Ultram ER - the first few days I really didn't notice that much relief - by the 4th day I felt 10 years younger, could move and walk freely and the pain in my side was gone. It was a miracle! I ran out of the sample on the weekend and by Monday am - i could hardly move. I have experienced a great relief from hip/side pain - also the stiffness in my hands/feet has improved. I have experienced no side effects. Having taken several different pain relievers as well as muscle relaxants, I would highly recommend Ultram ER. I have now taken the 200 mg dose, once daily for one month and it has greatly improved my quality of life, movement, work and mental attitude. When you suffer dibilitating pain for a long period, you "wait" for it to come back as the medication wears off. I no longer have that dread, the Ultram ER seems to relieve it on a steady basis. No, I am not always pain free or uphoric - I just feel normal - I still have some pain - but nothing I can't tolerate. I am 61 years old and work fulltime - I take care of a 2 story split/level home - so their are stairs everywhere. I can now go up them again at a quick pace without the banister ( I was pulling myself up before). I am so thankful to be painfree and not "drugged".

I now have to be careful now not to injure my shoulder further, because I can move it so freely now without pain that I am using the arm in ways that I haven't been able to in years.  My shoulder lets me know within hours of a missed dose because the pain starts returning and the strength is limited.

column2: charlotte, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: ULTRAM ER 300MG WITHDRAWALI have a large paracentral and foraminal disk extrusion at C6-7 level also shallow central disk protrusion from C2-C5 with narrowing.  I have had pain for the last 8 yrs so severe at times have discussed with Dr Barth Green at UOM the possibility of surgery.  He claims he will not open my neck unless I am in so much pain that I cannot tolerate it.  I appreciate his conservative approach.  After speaking with several post-ops with same cervical extrusions for 15 cases 1 success 14 nightmares.  Pain was relieved but now other issues.  I have tried everything from physical therapy, trigger point injections to enough pain killers and muscle relaxers to kill a horse and never seemed to get any relief.  After seeing my neurologist due to migraine that lasted 9 weeks he suggested Ultram ER.  I had taken Ultram back in the day and it did nothing for the pain and made me sick.  It was the last step before surgery.  I am on 300mg a day and I have had absolutely NO pain or like I call them the electric shocks that run down the right side of my body and send me into orbit and make me look like Elaine from Seinfeld dancing.  The only issue is the withdrawal.  I did not pick up a prescription for a couple days after my prior one ran out and the withdrawal was the WORST!  I was sweating but had goose bumps the size of golf balls and was freezing to death, nose running, anxiety, shakes, skin crawling and NO sleep.  I did some research online and found they have documented the withdrawal is comparable to a morphine withdrawal (I have a new found respect for drug addicts).  This is something you must taper off of.  I am scared to death to stay on this any longer even with the benefit of NO pain.  The withdrawal is not something I ever want to experience again.  I am now finding that if I do not take the dosage by the same time each day I start the withdrawal symptoms (not as severe as not taking for several days).  I dont know if I am just very sensitive

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Was prescribed 300mg dose for sciatica.  Took one dose two days ago at 6pm.  Pain was totally gone within an hour.  Six hours later, neausea, vomiting, dizziness, stiff muscles, drowsy, weak, exhausted.  Haven't taken another dose.  Will call Dr. to see if a lesser dose would be appropriate.  Major concern here is that I'm about 90lbs and was given max dose to start.  With the severe side effects I'd suggest talking with your Dr. to be sure you're starting on a low enough dose to avoid the side effects.  I don't understand why anyone would be given the max dosage to start.  It's much easier to increase dosage if needed than to deal with horrible side effects to start with.  There is no way I can handle the side effects long enough for my body to get used to this dose.  If you've been given this medication and have severe side effects, check with your Dr about the dosage.

column9: I suffer from multiple disc hernitations as well as spinal stenosis and complete loss of lumbar curve. I was taking Norco 10/325 and Skelaxin t try and relieve my pain. I began taking WAY too many Norco's over the course of a day (10-12). My doctor just switched me to Ultram ER 300mg, Oxycodone 5/325 and Skelaxin 800mg. I was wondering if anyone else is taking this combination and if so what kind of side effects are you experiencing?

column2: diabetic1, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This along with arthritis strength Tylenol does the trick for me. It reduces the pain from my foot neuropathy as well as my back osteoarthritis.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this drug for about 2 years. At first I started out with 200mg. It was horrible. It knocked me out, made me feel weird and I was throwing up every few days. I thought I would get adjusted to it, but I did not. The only good thing is it worked on the pain. I was put on something else. Later my Dr. moved, new Dr put me back on Ultram (Tramadol) on a lower dose. 50 mg. I was reluctant but tried it. It worked so well. It really takes care of the pain and I do not have the side effects. The only problem now is if I take it late in the day it interrupts my sleep at night. Its hard to fall asleep and stay asleep. If I miss a dose, I will get a really bad headache. If I'm religious about taking it regulary, it works really well. I will continue to take the 50mg.

column2: EveryonesMom, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took one dose and experienced what several other reviewers stated  -- severe nausea and vomiting, along with the worst migraine I've ever had.  The side effects ended when the drug wore off.  I will never take it again.

column2: aniamalover, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: ive been living with cronic pain for 7years now this medication has taken me from level 8 down to lvl 5 in just 2 weeks

column2: ket, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had lower back and leg pain for past 15 years. Don't know what is causing pain as of yet. I live in pain daily either from back or my legs. I am now seeing someone to try and figure out what exactly is causing this, meanwhile the doctor gave me this to try, as I have been taking hydrocodone for pain, but that didn't take care of it all the way. Ultram ER, I took it yesterday at about 8pm, felt fine, slept fine, but this morning!, wow! absolutley pain free, not even a twinge of pain. BUT I have thrown up, and it is now 9pm the following day and I have been spaced out all day, feel like I have been dizzy all day, do not like the feeling, so don't think I will take it again, unless I can get a lowere dose, as mine was 200mg sample.  Love the relief it gave, but not the messed up feeling.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I got hit by a car and my knee and lower back got injured.  I have a pinched siatic nerve and two bulging disks in my lower back.  And now my knee has heeled.  I quit the meds and went through withdrawl from them, and didn't know what I was experiencing. I felt as if I was missing something, for almost two weeks.  There weren't any side effects, but I learned that I could go longer than 24 hours at times without taking another pill if I was late, it really didn't matter.  It didn't completly take away the pain but it made it bearable.  I couldn't take hydrocodone, because it messed with my blood pressure too much and the darvocets made me sleep all the time.  On this I didn't feel tired, or anything that any of these people that had side effects experienced.

column2: wee1, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Doctor put me on 200mg about a week ago to help with chronic pain from headaches caused by a bludging disc in my neck and oestoarthritis. I take 200mg of Celebrex to help with the arthritis and the Ultram is for the actual headaches.Formerly I was taking regular tramadol dosed at 100mg every 6 hours as needed. My doctor chose to put me on Ultram ER at 200mg in hopes that it would help manage my headaces better by lasting longer in my system.So far its been okay. Like any drug it needs to be taken at the first sign of pain however, that it not as easy as it sounds. I've found if I'm in a lot of pain 7-8+ it seems to work better if I take it with Arthritis Strenght Tylenol and 10mg Flexerial. The combination really helps alleviate the pain to the point where it is manageable.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am only taking 50 mg, but it is every 6 hours.  I am having no side effects so far, I believe this is due to the fact that it is a low dose.  It was prescribed to me for back pain.  The pain is not completely gone, but definitely reduced.  Overall, I think it is a good medication.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I tried Lyrica and it was horrible!  I couldn't function at all!  This is much better and I feel like I am still "in control" yet the pain has subsided!

column2: littlestar234_, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
1speedfreak, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Ultram ER was given to me along with Plaquenil, and Mobic.  I take Ultram at night and it keeps working the following day.  Wears off about 2 hours befor next dose. I am so glad my rheumatologist prescribed it.

Was given sample of Ultram ER from doc & an increase in strength of vicodin...doc wanted me to try both (at different times) to see which worked best for my pain. I tried Ultram ER the 1st time today...initially I thought it worked better than stronger vicodin, but it knocked me out.  1 dose at 200 mg...I slept all day, felt "weird" & I itch like crazy...the itching is driving me crazy.  Was glad for the sleep it induced, for sleep isn't easy to come by when you have severe pain, & it did alleviate my pain, but I don't think I like being so out of it & weak feeling...utterly weak & itching like mad....STILL.  Luckily my doc gave me a free sample of this & I didn't have to waste my money on this.  I guess in an emergency pain situation, like I was in, I'd probably take it again if nothing else helped my pain, but now I can't sleep due to this horrific itching.  Yes, it also killed my appetite & made me fuzzy-headed...unable to think...but this itching, whoa, this is unreal!  How long until it gets out of my system?  Yikes!  I'm itching all over, like I have chicken pox or a gazillion mosquito bites all over!  This drug has made me nauseated, too.  Nah, maybe I won't take it again.

column2: Liam, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've taken Ultram for years due to multiple surgeries. It's not particularly good for acute pain, but it works very well for chronic pain management. I can actually work and perform at a high level while taking Ultram. Can't do that while taking the heavy narcotics. I just switched to the Ultram ER. I'll know more about it's effectiveness in a week or so.

column2: krjmarketing, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am taking 300 mg for chronic pelvic pain due to adhesions and IBS. I also had to get adjusted to the medication. It does make you loopy and sleepy. Maybe even nauseated. But this does go away. The pain has significantly decreased but not totally gone.  I finally do feel some long-term relief which I have need for at least 10 years now.
works like over the counter tylonal

column2: beth 28, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this medication after a vasectomy. I took the first pill and it didn't seem to help. I took another pill the next day and that is when I REALLY GOT SICK.(headache,vomiting)I then got online and figured out the side effects and others reactions. I am very displeased with my doctor, this drug. I wonder if any real clinical trials were done on this medication!

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I take 200mg of Ultram ER every morning for chronic knee and back pain. Unfortanetly, it only takes about 75% of my knee pain away and my back still hurts. It definitly reduced the severity of my pain, but when I don't take it, my pains get worse. When I first started taking Ultram, I got very itchy and felt like I was catching the flu (nausa, head spins, chills, etc.). I stopped taking the pills for about two days and I no longer felt sick but was in alot of pain, so I decided to try the medication again. The sick feeling came again with itches but finaly went away after about 4 days of taking the pill every morning.

column2: 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Diabetic neuropathy, figromyagia, and osteo arthritis.  It seems to control the pain on all easily.  At start of treatment.  Time will tell.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started taking Ultram ER 100 mg for nerve pain after all other types of medicines would not work.  Within 3 days my pain was almost non existent.  This medicine has been a miracle for me in the sense of tremendously helping my pain.  However since on Ultram ER I always feel short of breathe and my blood pressure and heart rate have increased. I'm not sure if it is from this medicine or not though.  I have now tried several times to get off this medicine  to see if it's causing my other symptoms and just missing one dose my pain starts to return and I notice that I'm shaky and just don't feel well overall so I'm not sure how I'll be able to get past the withdrawal symptoms.

column2: 3furballs, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication did help the pain but gave me a TERRIBLE side effects. Decided the morning after to NEVER take the drug again. column2: bhalsey, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have Chronic Back Pain and Kidney Stone Pain. I usually pass a kidney stone every 2 weeks. I was taking narcotic pain medication since I was 13 years old. Since I have been taking this medicine, I have had a lot less daily pain. This medicine has given me my life back!

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took one pill and will never touch the stuff again. While it relieved the pain a bit, the side effects were horrendous. column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had 6 back surgeries which include 2 spinal fusions.  I had been using hydrocodone for about 15 years at least 4 times per day. I sleep at night, wake up without the need to take a pain pill, and can go almost all day with only needing to take one hydrocodone.  This drug has been a miracle for me.  I am on my second month of using it.

column9: I call Ultram my miracle drug.  I took narcotics everyday either for headache, leg pain or back pain.  Some months I have cut my narcotic use by 75%.
